ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Greetings
ygData.msgSnippet: Wooot!  You can get university level credit for writing about EQ?  That rocks! Before EQ, I hadn t been involved in gaming since my kids were born and I had to
ygData.messageBody:
Wooot! You can get university level credit for writing about EQ? That
rocks!

Before EQ, I hadn't been involved in gaming since my kids were born and I
had to quit AD&D because I didn't have 5 hours at once lick to play. EQ
has been great because I can play it around MY schedule. Putting shoes on
kids and making breakfast in the morning is built around my wizard's med
time! :-)


*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 10/19/03 at Mary Beth wrote:

____>Hello,
____>
____>I'm Mary Beth and I play a 65 Dark Elf Cleric (Brinni) and a 65
____>Human Monk (Naiya) on the Ayonae Ro server. I belong to the guild
____>Legend of the Jokers www.lotj.net and I have just ran across this
____>mailing list. I would love to be a part of it and meet some new
____>everquest players; female ones at that!
____>
____>I should also mention that I am doing a University paper on the
____>women of everquest. The other reason I decided to join this mail
____>list is to get some opinions from other women who play everquest and
____>what it means to them to be involved in this type of mporpg. If
____>anyone is interested in finding more information out about my
____>research paper and wouldn't mind answering a few questions, feel
____>free to contact me either through here or privately.
____>
____>Thanks and I look forward to meeting all of you!
____>~Mary Beth
____>
